dialogues.text: THRASH and POKE their way forward leaving trails through high grass.  Their attempt at an orderly progression quic falls apart as they get strung out all over the field. ABBOT (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay together.  Together... Then another movement catches the Abbot's eye -- AHEAD of the Monks - the wheat waves against the wind. Begins to ripple -- the wheat flattens. a TRAIL forms. SomeTHING is MOVING in the long grass. Moving towards the Lead Monk -- FAST. The Abbot opens his mouth as if to shout a warning - even though the Monk closest to the moving trail is too far aw hear him - before he can make a sound The Alien closes th Feeling horribly helpless he can only watch as AARGH-Aa -! The Lead Monk gives one strangled CRY before he disappear beneath the surface of the long grass.  His taper falls among the long, dry stalks -- begins to SMOKE... The Abbot can see the trail moving towards his men before can.  He finds his voice: ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!  RUN! The Monks in the field turn from the spot where the Monk screamed towards the Abbot -- TURN THEIR BACKS to the now moving again trail -- ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - NO.  The -- The Alien hits the skirmish line at a flanking angle -- RAKING through five Monks like a scythe through wheat. His tail, arms WHIP out -- SNAP their spines like kindling. Lost torches ignite the wheat... The field BURSTS INTO FLAME. Smoke fills the air. In the smoky commotion the Monks break rank and start run Weapons in front of them -- SWINGING wildly -- Screaming.  Crying.  DYING. One Frightened Monk runs through another with his pitchfo Another hears something crashing through the grass toward him and buries his scythe in his best friend's chest. And through it all the Alien seems to be everywhere. Using the chalky smoke for cover as it SLASHES and TEARS across the field --

dialogues.speaker: THE ABBOT
dialogues.text: Frozen in terror to the spot.   Squints through the smoke what has happened to his flock.  Hears the WAILS of defea rising up from the wounded. The waving grass is flattened as The Alien moves towards He can finally pry himself from his perch on the wagon. He climbs down.  As his feet hit the wooden floor he feel shadow fall over him.  The little hairs on the back of hi stand up.  He slowly turns...

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Rises out of the grass in front of the Holy Man. Slowly rises up to its height of almost three meters. It's long, smooth head is no longer black and slimy. It is golden. It's cable-like arms are sheathed in a straw-like coverin It has adapted to the environment of the wheat field.  It grass-like lips draw back into a ghastly parody of a smil The Abbot SCREAMS and RUNS. JOHN O/S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't your fault, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move across the huge room...Anthony a few paces ahea Their candles throwing only enough light to see several y Wind whistles through the huge room, timbers creaking lik gigantic old house settling. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things you said before -- Ripley remembers her "confession." JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read about it in psychology books. Sometimes when people outlive someone they cared for, they transfer some of the guilt for that person's death to themselves. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a belly full of that from the Psychtechs when I was on Earth.  Yeah. "Survivor Guilt syndrome," or something like that.  But that's not what I was thinking about.  I was thinking about my "friend" up there. She looks up. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was on the pod.  He killed Newt but not me.  Why not me?  It's almost like he's playing with me.  Maybe they have some sort of race memory.  Maybe he knows what I did to his "mother." That's why he didn't just kill me. That would be too easy.  He has to torment me. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make it sound human. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I don't know what it is. John unconsiously fingers his book. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the space a rough hewn wooden ladder leads another block of cell corridors four stories up. Years of damp air have warped the ladder. Ripley leads the way, torch in her left hand. They climb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Ripley is the first one up. She raises her torch and heads down the new corridor alon The cells here have no doors. She holds her torch in one -- An old skeleton sits in quiet contemplation.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE LADDER
dialogues.text: John is just climbing off, Anthony right behind him.   Anthony is winded.  He reaches up for a helping hand. John looks back and sees that Ripley has moved ahead with them, then reaches down to help Anthony. Their hands clasp --

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY HAS A "VISION"
dialogues.text: He is seemingly standing in an open field, sheep grazing peacefully at his side. SUDDENLY he is ATTACKED by a horde of Medieval demons. Fish faced demons.  Man-headed bird demons. They fly about him, grab hold of his limbs. The Sheep nearest him opens it's mouth to reveal a horde razor sharp fangs, SINKS THEM INTO HIS ANKLE -- Anthony SCREAMS -!

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY
dialogues.text: Down the corridor HEARS the scream, turns back -- sees An fighting with himself, struggling against John's grasp -

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: Balanced precariously on the top of the ladder in the rea world as he fights against the demons in his android mind He JERKS -- Pulls his left ankle out of the grasp of the DEMON SHEEP OFF the ladder - forty foot drop waiting below him...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Struggles to keep his death grip on Anthony's hand. It's all that keeps Anthony from falling back down the sh JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.  Ripleeeee -! He PULLS with all his might...

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: SEES a horrible BIRD-DEMON grasping his hand in its beak BITING through his wrist.  He waves his staff in the air He aims for its head:

dialogues.speaker: CRACK -
dialogues.text: WHACKS John's hand with his staff -- John HOWLS in pain - LETS GO -- Anthony TEETERS BACK ON ONE FOOT, arms waving in the air Ripley's hands SHOOT OUT -- GRAB Anthony's cassock -- STOP his fall. Anthony's eyes open wide at the sight of this new horror A terrible, wet, black cable-armed CREATURE that's latche itself onto his cassock -- Long, shiny head. Ripley has become the Alien.

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: Anthony HITS the Creature with his staff -- HITS Ripley on the head.

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: Again.  In the face. John tries to take hold of Anthony's staff arm --

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: The cane WHIPS against the side of his head, knocking him Ripley sets her feet and pulls on Anthony's cassock -- Opens her mouth - GRUNTS -- ANTHONY sees the terrible Alien open it's maw to devour h

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: His staff connects with the bridge of Ripley's nose. She sees flashes of light -- loses her balance -- Pitches forward, starts to go over with Anthony --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN GRABS THEM
dialogues.text: Wraps his arms around the struggling pair and like a sumo wrestler LIFTS and FALLS backwards - carrying the three o into the corridor -- WHUMPH! They land on the floor in a heap. Anthony continues to FLAIL ABOUT -- Ripley and John pin him to the floor between them. Finally, the vision leaves him. He loses consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Breathing heavy - opens his eyes -- He's staring right into Ripley's face. Less than an inch away. He's laying on top of her. She's breathing heavy too. A long, uncomfortable moment. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. They roll off each other. Her hand goes up to her nose. Blood. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all right. John reaches into his bag, withdraws a small cotton bag. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this against your nose.  It'll stop the flow. She looks over at him questioningly. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a doctor. She holds the small bag against her nose.  The bleeding s They move over to Anthony - try to help him to his feet. He shakes them off. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - please.  Just let me sit. Awhile. He rubs his temples.  White, milk-like sweat runs down hi cheek. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reason I'm down here. John points to his own eyes. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visions. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dreams. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Androids can't dream... ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's probably what they thought when they built me.  But my brain is cyber- organic - patterned after the human brain - it functions the same way a human brain does.  It accumulates random images and sensations during waking  hours, but unlike the human brain that sloughs them off during sleep -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Androids don't sleep. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Maybe they've fixed this on later models, but I don't.  Do you know what  happens to the human brain when it is deprived of sleep?  It starts to run off the dreams while you're awake, as  hallucinations.  Same thing with me. For twenty years I absorbed data on this planetoid.  A little after we lost contact with Earth the visions started.  They thought I was insane.  I had to explain  that it was because I was an android. They liked that even less. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see? ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I always see.  Images of Monsters. Demons. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're portents.  They stand for an evil yet to come. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just images I've absorbed from those old books and have no way to get rid of. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the inside of your cell. ANTHONY (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head is full of them.  I try to get them out any way I can. His eyelids droop. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need sleep. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.  I'll settle for rest. He closes his eyes.  Ripley recovers the torch. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with him. Ripley tried to stand - John takes her arm, pulls her dow JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We all need rest.  You especially. Ripley considers him. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor's orders. She smiles and sits. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, you see what happens when you get ahead of us.  We should stay together. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  He's still above us, anyway. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've faced this evil twice before - I guess I've gotten sensitive to it -- (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really a Doctor? John pats his canvas bag. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See my bag? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that book? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a book. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't buy "just a book" from a guy who says we can't leave the planet without the library.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... a medical book I might need. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have any food in there, do you? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you can eat bandages. Ripley rubs her midsection. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a few hours that's going to sound good.  Going in and out of suspended animation - Christ I probably haven't eaten in a year. ANTHONY (without opening eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've eaten the bread. RIPLEY AND JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest! Ripley lets her head loll back against the wall. Closes her eyes.  Time passes. Her brow knits. John sees this. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aces. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't hurt when I landed on you? Bruised a rib? He reaches over and puts his hands beneath her cassock. Feels her midsection.  His hands are warm. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're a doctor? He withdraws his hands. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.  My father passed on when we  first came here.  The Abbey's Physician - Father Anselm - took me in.  He really raised me -- (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taught me what he could before he passed away.  He was schooled on Earth. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm just hungry. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't eaten since I took you out of your tube. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did that... She reaches out and takes hold of his hands.  Turns them RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You burned yourself on the escape pod. Her hands on his makes him feel...uncomfortable. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, I guess. They look into each other's eyes -- ANTHONY O/S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've eaten the bread. Ripley, embarrassed, releases his hands. Looks at Anthony.  He's trying to stand. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough rest.  There's beasties afoot. They start into...

dialogues.speaker: A NARROW CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Ceiling so low their torches must be held out in front of Ripley makes an effort not to move faster than the two mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great long ladder hanging in the middle of nowhere. Seems at least a mile long. The group climbs...

dialogues.speaker: A SERPENTINE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Liquid drips through the ceiling planks over head. Falls into RED puddles on the slanted floor. John kneels, dips his fingertips -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood. (sniffs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mixed with sea water. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting close to the center of the arc -- near the sea. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting close... John HEARS somthing. Raises his hand -- "stop" The group stops.  Flatten themselves against the wall. John takes Anthony's staff. Moves forward with it held out in front of him... WHIRLS around a blind corner -- SHOVES something against the wall -- Thump! It struggles -- Ripley and Anthony run up -- raise their tapers -- Revealing: RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Abbot. Cassock torn, dirty.  Hair, eyes wild. Anthony's staff across his throat.  John pulls back. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father -- RIPLEY (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing down here, father? You look like you've seen something that doesn't exist. The Abbot runs his fingers through his hair.  Smoothes it ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was their spiritual leader.  I was not prepared to lead them in battle. Not against that thing. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one could be. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said the evil was inside me -- that sealing me up was the answer to all your problems? ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destruction.  The destruction YOU brought to us! RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only tried to warn you. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing with this woman --? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to the Technology Room. Trying to find some way to fight -- ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't join the devil to fight the devil. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's helping us -- ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who defends the deceiver -- the one who isn't even human.  John, can't you see what is happening?  On ancient Earth, during the Black Death - many believed that God had abandoned them, so they appealed to the Devil.  Flocked to him hoping to save their bodies - losing their souls in the bargain. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, we're all on the run from the  same monster so let's not resort to the fire and brimstone routine.  I've been enlightened about your "movement." Pretty funny to be tried for heresy on a planet of heretics. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  The time for pretense is past. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  I was trying to keep you quiet.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir --? ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do what I have to do to keep the Brotherhood together.  We all gave up believing in Earth a long time ago.  How do you think they would feel if told their exiled was in vain?  That the holocaust they were trying to avoid never occured?  Those men up there have grown to live with it. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with you as their leader. The Abbot smiles.  Ripley is sharp. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You threatened the status quo. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you, protector of knowledge and truth, lied to them. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only about you.  The rest I still believe.  If Earth still orbits its sun there is no way it could have survived being reduced to Barbarism. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're as bad as the Company. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you ran.  After all your talk death stared you in the face and you were afraid. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not afraid of death. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Organism. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The now four refugees work their way into the final corri Dark.  Turns at sharp angles.  Blind alleys. The floor is uneven, wood aged and twisted. Warped by years of water dripping from above. The group strings out as it moves into the darkness, cand held high...

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY
dialogues.text: Bringing up the rear, puts his walking stick down --

dialogues.speaker: SNAPP
dialogues.text: Everybody stops at the sound. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Anthony pulls his stick from the grasp of a-- ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man trap. They lower their candles.  Look to:

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Interspersed throughout the timbers -- Spring jawed, steel toothed, BEAR TRAPS. Rusted.  Open.  And all around them. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case anyone tried to get in and tamper with the technology. The four of them are standing in the middle of a mine-fie man traps.  Nobody moves. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move.  Don't breath. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't just stand here and wait. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floor's too unstable to try to walk around them. John pulls a loose board from the corridor wall. Turns and kneels at the trap in front of him. Pokes the end of the board into the jaws...

dialogues.speaker: SNAP
dialogues.text: The others jump at the sound -- ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John - what are you doing? John pulls the stick out of the rusted jaws. Moves to the next trap -- Snap!! RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's thinking like a leader.  Everyone: Grab wood.  Spring the traps.  Clear a path. (proud of him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work, Father John. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother.  Let's go. Ripley pulls a plank from the wall next to her.   Exposes a bit of the surface underneath -- It's METAL. She touches the cool, familiar material.  Smiles. Now she knows this is not a dream. She turns and SPRINGS the trap in front of her --

dialogues.speaker: THE FOUR
dialogues.text: Slowly make their way down the corridor, one hand holding candle high, the other poking a piece of wood into the tr front of them... SNAP-SNAP...SNAP. SNAP. walking carefully around the yet unfired traps....

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR TO THE TECHNOLOGY ROOM
dialogues.text: A huge wooden door with no knob or handle.  Looks like it almost be part of the wall.  John and Ripley are the firs it.  They put down their planks and begin to feel around edges of the door for some purchase. The Abbot joins them.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Anthony lags behind.  He senses a presence in the hallway Hears a sound behind him. We see a GLIMPSE of something -- He turns towards the sound -- Empty hallway. He thinks.  Starts forward again -- with his ear cocked t rear... SNAP!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Ripley, John and The Abbot knock on the door, walls. Ripley leans her head against the wall in frustration and exhaustion.  To get this far, and be locked out. She feels sick to her stomach. How long since she had food? She looks over at John. He is staring at her. He turns red at being caught.  Cute. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just - are you allright? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tied.  Without sleep, food -- I just feel my age. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figuring hyperspace time, I'm almost a hundred. She wipes her brow and goes back to knocking... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? The wall beneath his fist sounds hollow. Fingernails find the edge of the plank and pull -- The plank slides aside on tiny, rusty pneumatic pistons.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE PLANK
dialogues.text: A primitive KEYBOARD.  Circa late twentieth century. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is it. Ripley and the Abbot move over to see. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Technology. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - a hundred years ago.  An antique. ABBOT (to Ripley)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and what? ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door, woman. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get to it, but listen to me -- you may dress like you're living in the middle ages but you can't treat me like your chambermaid, or whatever Monks had.

dialogues.speaker: UP THE HALL
dialogues.text: Hears the sound again.  Turns. Nothing again. He pauses... Turns back quickly -- The wooden wall MOVES - steps forward --

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Adapted itself to look like WOOD. It's body changes -- transmutes -- Cable-like sinew snaki over grained limbs to approximate the more traditional bi mechnoid alien appearance...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The weary android sees the Alien as a conglommoration of many Medieval images of demons.  He hears the Alien's hol raspy breath.  It glides towards him... Anthony steps back directly INTO A TRAP as his mind goes

dialogues.speaker: SNAP
dialogues.text: The STEEL JAWS spring shut on his left ankle. Milky blood-fluid starts to flow. He finds himself in the same predicament as his vision -- Ankle pinned, the Alien's appendages circling him -- He screams.  AAAAAAAAAAAARGH --!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Ripley is trying to work.  She punches numbers into the k She is too exhausted to see straight. They HEAR the scream -- John RUNS back -- Traps SNAPPING around him -- Ripley turns towards the sound -- The Abbot pushes her back to the keyboard -- ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: OPEN IT
dialogues.text: Ripley knits her brows.  Forces herself to focus. Her fingers punch the keys.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Steps towards Anthony -- Snap-snap-SNAP-AP-!! Traps snap closed on its tail, its legs --

dialogues.speaker: SNAP
dialogues.text: His cassock is snagged in a trap. He TEARS right out of it --

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF THE HALL
dialogues.text: Anthony is in the clutches of the Alien. He WHACKS at the Beast with his staff, but his blows fall drops of rain on an elephant. The Alien LIFTS him up to face him.  Anthony SCREAMS as h leg is stretched agsinst the tension of the trap's chain Blood pouring as white ribbons from his almost severed an

dialogues.speaker: FACE TO FACE WITH THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Anthony drops his staff and grabs each of the alien's arm his own android arms.  His extra-human strength keeps the squeezing him any tighter, but he cannot avert his gaze f the smooth, eyeless face. The Alien considers him.  Its thin, almost translucent li back to reveal rows of splinter-like teeth.  The jaws spr making room for the distended tongue: The Alien HISSES -- PUTS OUT Anthony's EYES with a thin stream of ACIDIC SALI Artificial skin BUBBLES AND BLISTERS --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Picks up Anthony's staff. Begins to FLAIL away at the demon.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Ripley is getting no response from the keyboard. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?! Ripley slides the keyboard out of the wall compartment. The wires are so old they've broken. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. She BITES the ends off the wires - spits out the insulati TWISTS the bare wire ends together... Sweat runs into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: WHACKS the Alien with Anthony's staff -- Again.  Again.  The creature will not let Anthony go. The Android writhes in its grasp, his face now a blistere pulpy mass, eyes gone.

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY
dialogues.text: Finishes hot wiring.  The keyboard hums to life. Her fingers FLY across the keys --

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Tail wraps around John's waist -- Pulls him towards it -- LIFTS him - turns him upside down -- Lips PULL BACK -- John's hands GROPE at the floor -- Sharp metal teeth SPREAD --

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR KEYBOARD
dialogues.text: Lights:  CODE ACCEPTED Ripley's head whips towards the corridor --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: His hand closes around the end of one of the traps -- He brings it up --

dialogues.speaker: SNAP
dialogues.text: It SLAMS closed on the Alien's extended Tongue -! The Beast bellows!! Whips its head from side to side -- Can't shake off the trap -- ACID BLOOD sprays out --! Lands as pools of FIRE on the wooden floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Opens with a strained blast of dust -- SEE-WHORCSSH! The Abbot LEAPS inside -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's open!!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: PRIES Anthony's ankle out of his trap. Scoops up his staff, drags the moaning Android -- Back up the corridor --

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY
dialogues.text: Stands in open Technology Room doorway -- ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close it -- close it -- it's coming - RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait.  John!! John and Anthony appear out of the shadows -- Run/hobble towards the door --

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Acid Blood DISSOLVES the traps' steel jaws.  PULLS itself Head whips towards the escaping Monks -- if it had eyes t would narrow to slits in anger -- RUNS up the hall --

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY
dialogues.text: Follows John and Anthony into the Technology Room. On the other side of the doorway: another keyboard. She punches keys -- ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Yards away -- Limping.  Hissing. ANGRY.

dialogues.speaker: THE KEYBOARD
dialogues.text: Acceptance tone "bings." The Door starts to slide down -- The Alien is feet away -- INCHES... The door seats itself closed with a solid THUD. Ripley, panting, rests eyes closed against the rough wood door.  A beat. She turns to the room for the first time and finds --

dialogues.speaker: WINDMILLS
dialogues.text: Real Man of LaMancha wood and cloth windmills.  Two story arms slowly rotating.  Moving enormous volumes of air thr the wind tunnel-like room.  As far as the eye can see. Turning, creaking. WHOOSH...WHOOSH... But no electronics.  No radio.  No weapons. This is the Technology Room. Ripley collapses to the floor and loses consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow warning lights PULSE.  Those goddamned STROBES are flickering on and off.  Steam blasts out overhead pipes. The blue-spark pilot light muzzles of a FLAME THROWER shy pokes out from behind a console.  It's owner cautiously follows...

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY
dialogues.text: She's breathing heavy. She's wearing a sweat soaked tank top. Her eyes flit from side to side.  Then up.  Then down. She pokes the weapon out ahead of her and moves into the She silently crosses the distance to Newt's sleep tube:

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TUBE
dialogues.text: Newt sleeps peacefully. Ripley allows herself one maternal smile, then remembers. Her grip TIGHTENS in the Flame Thrower in her hands. She flips a switch to HI HEAT. Moves around the sleep tubes... A noise to her left. She WHIRLS -- Pulls the trigger on the flame thrower -- click.  Nothing She tries again -- a half-hearted burp, but no flame. She begins to panic -- Senses the Alien's presence. Looks left, right, up - no Alien... Looks down: The Alien's tail is COMING UP BETWEEN HER LEGS. She turns -- Right into it's grasp. The useless flamethrower SKITTERS across the floor. She PUMMELS the beast with balled up fists. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  NO!  I beat you!  I beat you mother fucker!! The Alien spins her -- pushes her over across the sleep t Like it's taking her from behind! Ripley looks down into the sleep tube: Newt is gone. Her doll's head lays in a pool of blood. The Alien wraps his arms around Ripley. Thin lips pull back for a kiss. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley opens her eyes. WHOOSH...WHOOSH... She's still in the room with the windmills. Somehow this place seems less real than her dream. She looks around: John is sitting next to her, writing on a piece of parchm He smiles a relieved smile. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we'd lost you. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you writing? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last will and testament. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding. She looks to her left: Anthony is lying on his back, cotton bandage wrapped arou eyes.  His ankle is a swollen mess.  Wires are hanging ou RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he --? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resting. (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be fine. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I won't.  He's a terrible liar. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ironic.  I guess my visions were prescience after all.  How will I ever resolve that with my artifical con- science? A creaking floorboard to Ripley's right draws her attenti The Abbot.  He's pacing. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see what you've delivered us into? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Lead me not into temptation to kick your -- ahh -- Ripley tries to stand - her head spins. WHOOSH...WHOOSH... RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. The entire room THROBS with the rhythm of the wind. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the Big Boy -? The Abbot points to the door. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of that door. Waiting for us to starve to death. Ripley moves to the door and feels it's cold surface. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's playing with us.  It could get in here any time it wants. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should he enter?  He knows that one of the people in this room is in league with him. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.  We're all in the same coracle, so to speak. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe more than one of us. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's talk about the facts, Mr. Abbot. She looks at the windmills. WHOOSH...WHOOSH... RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your technology? ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even this is forbidden to us. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, the facts are that we're screwed. She moves into the room.  Walks around one of the Windmil RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Eco system.  Nothing to recycle your atmosphere except the green plants.  Winds generated down here -- (looks at the floor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windmills use the natural surface winds to turn wheels underground, create tides on the seas to recirculate your water... ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than that.  There are pumps beneath the floor - I can feel their vibration. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably pumping this air through charcoal filters. WHOOSH...WHOOSH... RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets colder all the time here, right? John looks at her questioningly. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wood burning fires throw soot into the atmosphere, building the cloud layer - cutting off the sun's rays - cooling the planet, forcing you to burn more wood. WHOOSH...WHOOSH... ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greenhouse Effect.  It's how the Earth almost destroyed itself in the late 20th century. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see?  This is a planet set to self destruct.  Not in ten minutes or two hours but soon.  Your atmosphere here is finite.  If the plants die the fires will eat up all the oxygen - this planetoid will be dead - Everyone will die. The Abbot has the look of a man who has been beaten in th few meters of a Marathon. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here.  I was just hoping I would be dead long before it came to this. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're supposed to die here.  That's the point. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute -- you were exiled --? ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The punishment for our crime was death. Anthony sits up. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This planet is the supreme triumph of planned obsolesence.  A certain amount of primitive materials with an atmosphere processing system as fragile as a real environment but not replenishable. The Abbot has a faraway look in his eyes... ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poetic justice for the anti-technologists. The Company's best work.  You know, I used to be a corporate executive.  Middle range V.P.  Then my wife got hit by a speed craft. I chucked it all and joined the order. Be a monk -- see the world.  Being here, being chairman of the board... RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, now I understand why I landed here. To join you happy lunatics in your  deaths. Ripley moves away... John starts after her. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley, wait -- The Abbot stands, blocks his way. ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can she go?  She's trapped. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapped inside her own prison.  A prison in her mind.  Inside her mind.  Dancing. Sparklets of light - dance with the june bugs in the recesses of ourmindstheyare coming to danceintheshadowof... John and Ripley turn to look at the Abbot. He begins to speak faster.  Faster. He shakes.  Vibrates is more accurate -- A trickle of BLOOD runs from his left ear... ABBOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RidingthewildwindsofchangeNoescapeNo escapeforthewickedEvilEvilthynameis woman.Woman.Womanheiscoming.Heiscoming foryouuuuuuuuu --*

dialogues.speaker: SPLORTCH-KT--
dialogues.text: The Abbot's HEAD EXPLODES --!!! Like a ripe melon dropped ten stories onto pavement. Blood, bone, hair and brain matter SPRAY John. John SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: A HORRIBLE ALIEN HEAD BURSTER
dialogues.text: Is all that sits atop the blood spurting neck of the Abbo It keeps it's hold on the Abbot's spinal cord -- The Abbo body continues to stagger around, arms jerking mechanical lack of fresh nerve impulses from the brain works its way through the system. Ripley SCREAMS. The Infant Alien-headed corpse stumbles towards her -- She plucks Anthony's staff from the floor and SWINGS -- -- Like a child hitting a baseball from a TEE --

dialogues.speaker: WHACK-K -
dialogues.text: BLASTS the Chest/head burster across the room -- It hits the floor SCRAMBLING.  Scuttles down into where t Windmills meet the floor.  Disappears. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BASTARD!!  It came out of his fucking head! ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have to see that to know what that means. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sent him to us.  That bastard outside. I can't get away from him.  He's fucking with my mind.  He's my punishment! ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm confused.  Before you said it came out of the torso, not the head -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel like a discussion of Alien biology. John comes up next to her. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley, don't -- She pushes him away and sinks to the floor. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should just wait for the air to run out... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe - I know - that we can win -- there is an answer in our books. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your books?  Your books are gone, Brother. Your world is gone.  Once that thing starts to lay its eggs, all your brothers - if they aren't already - are dead. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's true, then all of us, the books, are consigned to ashes. He clasps his hands and bows his head. The Abbot's blood drips off his hands. Plip - plop! Into a little puddle at Ripley's feet. She stares at the blood.  Aahk. Feels the PAIN again. Runs her hand across her chest... ANTHONY O/S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are several inconsistancies between this and the other Aliens you described. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is important.  This may help us fight it.  The creature that I fought in the hall - when I first saw it, it had camoflaged itself to look like wood. Ripley looks up.  RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood?  When I saw it in my room it looked the way it did before -- black, mechanical -- unless that was a dream. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it was.  I think that this  creature, if it is the efficient predator that you say it is, has the ability to adapt to its environment. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the reason they've always looked the same to me is that I only ever saw them in the same environment. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or this may be an as yet unseen stage of development -- you saw a queen -- This could be like a King ant -- more highly advanced than the drone, bred for  survival -? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does this explain the thing that came out of the ewe's chest?  The Abbot's head? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it can deposit different types of eggs.  The chest burster is probably dormant until the host eats - The first one I ever saw came out of Kane after he started to eat -- And in one horrible moment she realizes: She hasn't eaten.  The pain in her chest... RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Anthony "looks" towards her - does he realize as well? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No what? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're not beat yet, Father -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother -- Ripley gets up. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother.  Not yet.  If he's taunting me, then maybe we can use that.  We can beat this bastard.  We can get to my ship. We can live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands by a ladder that runs up to a trap door in th ceiling.  Holds a torch. Ripley is on the ground with Anthony, his injured leg spl out in front of him.  Skin is palid. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have second thoughts.  Blind and crippled I would only slow you down. Give him time to figure out what you're doing.  Just leave me my staff. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Good luck. She shakes his hand.  He pulls her closer. Anthony's empty eye sockets seem to see as he looks at Ri ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley, I know.  Good luck. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit tight. Ripley crosses to John.  Poised at the bottom of the ladd look up at the trap door on the ceiling. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could be waiting on the other side of that door.  We might not get ten feet before he kills the three of us. He shakes his head. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had better go, then. He smiles. She smiles back. They move up the ladder. It leads up a damp, short shaft, walls GREEN with algae,

dialogues.speaker: AN UNDERGROUND DOCK
dialogues.text: The ladder shaft opens onto a barnacled pier.  Ripley and climb out onto the wooden structure.  Before them: AN UNDERGROUND SEA stretches the width of the entire plan over five miles across.  The floor of the lowest level of top half of the orbiter makes a ceiling that looms a hund feet overhead. The water sparkles with a golden glow. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be day on the surface of the planet. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the light coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mirrors.  Reflect the outside light down great shafts -- through lenses.  That's what they make in the glass factory.  Lenses.  Look -- She turns:

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE WATERFALL
dialogues.text: Lit from within by daylight beaming down from above -- po into the sea a short distance from them. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opens to the surface.  Water flows in and out.  I don't know how.  There's one at either end.  I came down on the other side. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do? John points to three small leather and wood coracles bobb the end of their ropes. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony has dragged himself to a sitting position against bottom of one of the windmills.  He winces as he prods hi tender ankle with the end of his staff.  It SPARKS. The large canvas arms of the windmill rotate above his he The wind blows through his hair. WHOOSH...WHOOSH... Feels good. Anthony reaches up and waves his hand of his "eyes." ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the seer can only see what God wants him to.  Forty years on a planet of Monks and I've finally found religion. A floor board CREAKS. Anthony strains to hear: ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?  Ripley? WHOOSH...WHOOSH... He knows it is not. ANTHONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well come then.  I haven't got forever. A shadow falls across his face.  He can feel it. He doesn't have to see what is here.

dialogues.speaker: THE UNDERGROUND OCEAN
dialogues.text: The leather boat makes its way across the sea. John rows while Ripley holds the torch aloft. As night falls she takes the oars. The Ocean is dead calm.  The coracle glides across the gl like surface.  John flexes his scarred fingers. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hands okay? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be fine.  You've been on a boat before. Ripley squints ahead of them. The ocean seems to go on forever. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a warrant officer on a ship -- but I did all my sailing in space. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Anselm used to take me on his coracle when I was little. Ripley leans forward - scans his face. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old were you when they towed this satellite out here?         JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.  The Abbot said they put us to  sleep for the thirty years it took to get here.  We've had almost forty more.  Until now. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your mother? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never had one.  I mean, never knew her. I mean, I did, once.  She left my father when he joined the movement.  If she hadn't I wouldn't be here.  They kept the other children with the women, on Earth.  That was too long ago now.  Like a dream. Ripley's face grows strangely dark.  She turns to the wat RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that I was a mother? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl in the ship with -? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  On Earth.  I never mentioned my daughter.  My daughter.  I have - had I guess, by now - a daughter on Earth. Kathy.  She was nine when I signed on to the Nostromo.  Mommy will be home before you know it I said.  My shares would have set us up good.  Then I lost sixty years floating around in a rescue pod.  Thanks to the Alien.  I came home to face a bitter, 70 year old woman.  My daughter.  A little girl who's mother never came home. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said I should have been happy to be alive.  Funny, huh?  That's why I went back the second time.  Not so I could fight it -- You can't fight it -- So I could let it kill me. She rubs her chest -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't choose to get lost in space. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the try Father -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brother, but I'm not looking for absolution. I couldn't be a good mother to my daughter. I couldn't be a good mother to Newt.  But I can be a good mother to you.  I can make sure you survive. Suddenly they feel rain -- Ripley holds out her hand. Her eyes open wide at what she sees. John takes the oars as she holds the torch over the side: The Ocean has become red with BLOOD. Blood DRIPS down from the ceiling around them. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood. John looks up. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the levels above. His face goes white. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have slaughtered all -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think about it.  Don't think about what's up there.  Just row. As Ripley takes the torch away from the water, tiny rippl across the surface. She doesn't notice.

dialogues.speaker: A SHAPE
dialogues.text: Passes underneath the boat.  A swimming CREATURE.  The Al Thanks to the reflective qualities of water, it appears H Dwarfs their coracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the windmills are BURNING. Flaming arms lazily turning. Anthony is not in sight. Whoosh...Whoosh...

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER SIDE OF THE OCEAN
dialogues.text: Another dock with ladders going up and down. Ripley and John climb out of the coracle. Don't waste time tying off.  They go  --

dialogues.speaker: UP THE LADDER
dialogues.text: A hundred foot climb.  The wood is twisted. Rungs have been torn away in some places. They pull themselves up sections that have only the tinie foothold.  The temperature rises as they do. Sweat runs into their eyes. Soon they can see the floor above them: BLACKENED by intense heat. They climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley and John come up from the level below. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. John crosses himself. Another testament to the terrible battle with the Alien. Reduced to just a huge, blackened floor. All the crops burned to ash -- Their charred stalks mingled with the corpses of roasted Their nostrils assailed by the stench of the dead -- Ripley would puke if she had any food in her body. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Andrew.  And Raphael.  Peter... RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.  How far? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're right below the Abbey now. They cross the smoldering field. The scorched floor threatens to give way under John's fee Ripley pull him to one side.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONASTERY LEVEL
dialogues.text: Heaven has become HELL. The ground, the buildings, the Sky-timber - all blackened FIRES burn everywhere.  Air choked with gray smoke and du pouring in from the Orbiter's surface through rends in th vaulted ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY AND JOHN
dialogues.text: Climb through a hole where a trap door has been torn off hinges.  They look at the grim tableau: Monks impaled on their own pikes. Tangled together in their own pungy stakes. Alien cocoon material cobwebbed over their bodies.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONASTERY
dialogues.text: Flickering fires lit the first few floor windows. Ripley takes a step towards it -- Reaches back and pulls John...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Glass furnace boils almost to the point of overflow. Small fires burn out of control around the room. Finished glass pieces BURST from the heat. Ripley and John enter. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the glassworks.  They have tools here -- (spots)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle -- He runs across the room --

dialogues.speaker: BROTHER KYLE
dialogues.text: Sits calmly at the Marver table. He places playing cards on the table in front of him. Solitaire.   He sings to himself quietly. KYLE (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see my baby. Don't see my baby.  Bay be. John grabs him by the lapels - pulls him to his feet. The playing cards fall to the floor -- Kyle watches them, not John. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle.  Brother Kyle. KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cards on the floor, fifty two pickup. Black king on red queen, put the ace up -- John SHAKES him. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle goddammit! Ripley moves closer. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John - it's too late -- Kyle begins to sing faster.  Faster. KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ace up.  Put the ace up.  Redaceupup. Blackaceup.Up.Pup-pup-pup-chaka- boomloommawhacka -- Booomalooma looma -- Ripley and John look at each other. They know what this means. John pulls a length of rope off a nearby table. Moves in front of Kyle.  Looks into his glassy eyes. A tear runs down his cheek. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep singing, my friend. John loops the rope around Kyle's neck. Strangles him. Eases the lifeless body to the floor. Stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY
dialogues.text: Pulls a blowing iron from the rack.  Feels its weight and balance.  A reasonable weapon.  She crosses to John. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed him.  I'm a doctor and I killed him. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had to.  You're supposed to end suffering. She hands him a pontil, a pointed iron spear used to form molten glass shapes. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley and John move up the stairs. Flickering orange lit from below. Smoke and soot rise from the first on the lower floors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter carefully.  The room is exactly as John left i books out of shelves, hanging on their chains. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's made a mess. John pushes ahead of her. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He hasn't been up here yet.  I  did this. He moves to the nearest shelf and uses his pontil to pry the lock -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here - philosophy - we'll start here --

dialogues.speaker: AAAROO --
dialogues.text: A HAIRY BLUR flies out from between the stacks -- WHUMPH!  Knocks John to the floor -- Licks his face. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mattias! The happy dog leaps all over his master. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waited.  Ripley, this is Mattias.  My dog.  Good fellow. Ripley crosses to them. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad.  Really.  But we've probably only got a few minutes before this entire place goes up in flames.  Just grab whatever books you want and -- Ripley leans in to pet Mattias. Mattias draws his lip back.  Growls. He's looking over Ripley's shoulder. She turns around slowly...

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Standing in the open doorway. It's in bad shape from the man traps. Lost a foot.  Tongue hanging out, useless. Parts of it look like wood.  Parts of it look like wheat. It carries Anthony's waterlogged, limp body -- POPS off his head like a grape from the bunch. Tosses the corpse at Ripley's feet. I could swear it's trying to smile.

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY AND JOHN
dialogues.text: Back against the book stacks. John grabs Mattias' collar. The Dog GROWLS at the Alien intruder... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, boy... RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there another way out? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that will do us any good.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN
dialogues.text: Limps into the room dragging one foot. It's breathing is labored.  Dripping acid blood leaves a trail of fire behind it. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hurt it. The Alien draws itself up to its full height -- Even wounded it is one dangerous mother fucker. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna give it a bandage?  Look -- Where is my ship from here? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the roof directly above this room. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the plan --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the books -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the books!

dialogues.speaker: RUFF
dialogues.text: Mattias pulls free from John's grasp -- Runs to the Alien -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: MATTIAS
dialogues.text: Snaps and barks at the Alien -- Leaping about to dodge its claws. Draws its attention --

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY AND JOHN
dialogues.text: RUN at the Alien. It is trying to spear the dog with its tail. John swings the iron rod -- THWAP -! HITS the Alien across the back of its bulbous head -- It turns to him --

dialogues.speaker: SPLIIIITCH -
dialogues.text: Ripley SHOVES the blowing iron into the Alien's torso. His acid blood SPURTS out the end of the hollow tube -- SPLATTERS Ripley's cassock - she TEARS it off -- John grabs Mattias -- pulls him back. The Alien SPINS in a circle -- Blood SPRAYING around him - Creating a CIRCLE OF FIRE about him -- IGNITING the books -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  THE BOOKS!! RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't --! John steps forward -- Ripley grabs for him -- The ACID EATS through the wooden floor --

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR COLLAPSES
dialogues.text: The Alien, John and Ripley PLUMMET down -! THROUGH the next floor --

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE GLASSWORKS
dialogues.text: The Alien FALLS into the molten glass vat -- SCREECHES - arms flailing as it sinks beneath the surface the thousand degree liquid.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Finds himself HANGING over the bubbling glass vat - Caugh DANGLING on the Flying Fox rope.  Five feet away - the le Flying Fox is launched from.  He looks down: He can see the huge open vat of molten glass below him. right, the Water DUMP TANK - a large wine cask-looking af where finished pieces are cooled.  He looks up: Ripley holding onto the edge of the broken floor above. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Ripley grunts an affirmative response. At least is she falls, it will only be a twenty-foot drop the floor.  John is looking at instant par-boiling. John starts to move hand over hand UP the rope.  He begin sweat. A drop of sweat falls...

dialogues.speaker: HSSS
dialogues.text: POPS AND SIZZLES as it hits the surface of the molten gla

dialogues.speaker: RIPLEY
dialogues.text: Tries to pull herself up to the floor above -- The next level is a raging fire. She can only hang and DROP.  She DOES -! Falls the two stories. Bends her knees and ROLLS on impact.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Has reached the ledge overlooking the furnace. He stands.  Sees Ripley slowly rising -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley -! Ripley shakily gets to her feet. Hops on one foot. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aargh.  I'm fine.  Let's get the fuck out of --

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: THE ALIEN'S head breaks the surface of the molten glass. SCREAMING.  STEAMING.  It is white-hot - translucent -- covered with --  It looks like MOLTEN GLASS!! Hook-like hands grasp the edge of the tank -- It tries to climb out -- Ripley turns to run.  Tender ankle gives out. She falls face down on the floor -- Rolls over -- THE ALIEN is going to climb out of the vat -- She SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Grabs the Flying Fox handle. SWINGS down the rope - across the room -- PAST the Alien -- It turns away from Ripley - She scrambles across the floor... John lands HARD. Points -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley - the lever!! Ripley looks next to her:  a burning wooden lever. The Alien has one foot out of the glass furnace -- RIPLEY grabs the lever -- Hssssst! Putting out the fire with her hand -- Pulls --

dialogues.speaker: THE HUGE DUMP TANK OF WATER
dialogues.text: DUMPS.  Empties a thousand gallons -- RAINS DOWN on the Alien.  It HOWLS in pain -- The Molten Glass instantly COOLS -- The rapid extreme temperature change causes the beast to BE-THWOOOoooOOM -!! EXPLODE into a million pieces...!!!! Ripley helps John off the floor. They are battered.  Bloody. They look into the vat. The steam clears... The room is littered with Alien Bits. Each piece is encased in glass -- Trapped like a fly in amber. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw that happen to a bottle once. RIPLEY (panting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat... Beat him - ugh -- She grabs her stomach as her knees give out. John gives her an arm for support. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get to the Library -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  Ship.  Just -- They look up: Mattias looks down through the hole in the floor. BARKS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INFERNO. Every bookshelf ablaze.  The floor dotted with pools of f Ripley and John are at the door - held back by the heat - John tries to enter the room -- Ripley grabs him -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of them!  I've got to save some of them!  Mattias!! Mattias yelps in response.  Threads his way through to th Ripley spins him to face her.  Tears stream down his chee RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're lost.  You did your best.  If you get out, it wasn't in vain. We've got to live!! She YANKS him into the hallway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley's good foot KICKS down the burning planks that sur the escape ship.  John and Mattias stand behind as she cl through to the ship.  John looks around: The ABBEY LEVEL is devastated.  The air is filled with sm The Abbey is burning.  The Library is in flames. John looks down at his medical bag. Torn, bloody, scorched, it still hangs from his shoulders Inside: The only remaining book. RIPLEY O/S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in! John and Mattias step through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley CLICKS on the lights. John lifts Mattias into the hatch. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Library -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you -- the Earth is still there -- Ripley checks an instrument:  Elapsed travel time. Her brows knit.  She TAPS the gauge. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not working. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I don't know how long I was in hyper sleep. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means the Abbot could've been right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means my clock isn't working.  We have to get out of here.  Even if he was right this ship's onboard computer is filled  with man's knowledge. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everything.  Some things will be lost forever.  RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then man starts over.  He's done it before. She pushes a few buttons.  Somewhere under the floor a  propulsion source HUMS to life.  THROBBING through the so of John's feet.  Ripley is absorbed in her work. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  The seals weren't broken so we're probably clear.  But those dead monks out there are going to start hatching soon.  Let's get ready to take off. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, I need a compressor tank from in that compartment. She motions towards an open door. John enters the compartment. Whoosh-CLANG -! The door closes behind him. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  What?! He looks out the window in the door.   Ripley is staring at him, punching keys on a pad next to door. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - I'm locked in. Mattias scratches at the door. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I locked you in. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going with you.  I've got one inside me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  You can't -- She runs a hand across her midsection. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured it out.  That's why it didn't kill me.  He must have impregnated me when I was in the stasis tube. (remembers nightmare)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hasn't come out yet because I  haven't eaten, It's still dormant.  So either I eat and it kills me or I don't eat and I starve to death.  Either way  I die. John pulls the Medieval Tome out of his medical bag. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My book -- I know what to do -- RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, an exorcism?  No good. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this.  Ripley - listen to me - you're confusing feeling of guilt for actual sin - I can help you -- RIPLEY (ignoring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've set a time lock.  When the pod escapes the Colony's gravitational pull this compartment will open.  Then all you have  to do is get into the Stasis tube with Mattias and press the blue button.  With any luck a freighter or something will pick you up.  Good luck. He pounds his fists against the door. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!  No, Goddammit - you can't do this. You can't let it win. She turns away from the door. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It always wins.  We killed it, but it's still inside me -- You're my last chance. If I can keep you alive it'll make up for all those I've lost. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me!  You have to let me try! Ripley:  You're MY only chance! She's listening... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you Father Anselm raised me. He raised me and when he was dying I couldn't do anything to save him.  I  didn't know enough.  It was my fault he died.  If you don't let me try to save you my body will live but my soul will be dead. Ripley turns and stares at him. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: A MEDIEVAL ETCHING.
dialogues.text: A Monk vomits up the devil. Pull back as John lowers Ripley to the pod floor. John closes his eyes. Closes the book. He pours some water into a small plastic cup. Retrieves a small pouch of herbs.  Opens it. Wrinkles his nose - they smell -- pours these ancient medicines into the space age cup. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this stuff? JOHN (forceful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something that will make you well. Something that will make you sick. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and drink. He lifts the back of Ripley's head -- FORCES the drink down her throat. John swings his leg over her midsection.  STRADDLES her. Presses his two hands together in prayer. Then balls them into one fist. Takes a deep, preparatory breath... Ripley starts to GAG -- Cough. Her body starts to JERK -- John BRINGS HIS FIST DOWN INTO HER STOMACH --

dialogues.speaker: WHAMM -
dialogues.text: Ripley CONVULSES -- has the dry heaves --

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: John PUMMELS Ripley's diaphragm! She sputters -- VOMITS a thick mucous-like substance --

dialogues.speaker: HEAVES --
dialogues.text: Ripley's back arches -- She SCREAMS a gut wrenching WAIL -- Her torso BULGES as the creature is forced upwards. John BEARS down -- Pushes UP under her ribs -- FORCING the chest-burster up her throat -- Ripley fights for air as the alien STOPS halfway up her  esophagus -- She's choking -- John crosses himself -- takes a deep breath -- Lowers his mouth to hers -- Inhales.  Exhales.  CPR.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALIEN CHEST BURSTER
dialogues.text: SLITHERS out of Ripley's mouth --

dialogues.speaker: INTO JOHN'S
dialogues.text: Reptilian tail whips about before disappearing down his g John falls back against a computer console. Gagging.  Fights to speak. Ripley raises herself up on one elbow. Alien mucous drooling down her chin. Hair matted against her forehead. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choking.  It was the only way. He drops the open book in front of her: She sees the etching.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Gulps back the oozing slime. Struggles to his feet. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They knew. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you -- Ripley tries to stand - to go after him -- She can't sit up -- feels like a rib might be cracked. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll die -- John stumbles to the Pod door.  Turns back. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's idea.  Join...my brothers.  If we were right, Heaven.  If we were wrong -- either way, where we belong.  World of books.  Pages. He draws the parchment out of his bag. Drops it to the floor. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... are from the real world. He starts to step through the door -- Mattias tries to follow. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay -- both of you. He exits the Pod. Ripley drags herself across the floor. RIPLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - wait!  John! To the Door.  Looks out:

dialogues.speaker: BROTHER JOHN
dialogues.text: Dawn's rays are peeking through the battered ceiling as h walks slowly across the smoking roof. Into the inferno that is the burning Abbey. Ripley watches as John and the alien horror inside him ar INCINERATED. The heat of the flames grows. She must pull back -- Reaches up for the door handle. It closes with a THUD. She rolls onto her back. She weeps.  For the first time in years. She's been absolved. CREeeek -!! The escape pod SHIFTS. Ripley's eyes SNAP open -- The Roof beneath the Pod is beginning to GIVE WAY. Ripley rolls onto her stomach and drags herself to the pilot's chair.  Pulls herself into the seat. Straps herself in --

dialogues.speaker: SULACCO ESCAPE POD
dialogues.text: Blasts THROUGH the wooden outershell of the Orbiter Arceo ROARS towards us - past us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ripley places Mattias into the Hyper sleep tube. Rubs under his chin.  Is about to climb in with him when spots something on the floor --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN'S PARCHMENT
dialogues.text: Ripley picks it up and unrolls it. She hears John's voice: JOHN V.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, Brother John Goldman of the orbiter Arceon, Minorite abbey and gaol, know the Abbot was wrong.  There is a great evil here.  I have seen it.  I put pen to paper now lest this plague - this creature stills my hand.  I have gone down below - both to try to warn the others and get  the woman - Ripley - get from her some clue as to how to battle this evil, or at least to make my peace for not defending her.  She believes there is still and Earth and I hope she is right. I hope she will be able to find out. I hope she can find some rest for the devils that torment her. Ripley looks at the elapsed time counter on the command console.  Pulls a pen from it's holder.  She adds: RIPLEY V.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether the Earth exists or not, whether we end up in Heaven, or Hell, or the cold vacuum of space, she has. She sets her course. Gets back into her tube. Closes the lid.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP SPACE
dialogues.text: The escape pod moves through the jet-black void...

dialogues.speaker: ARCEON
dialogues.text: Dwindles into the darkness behind her, a smouldering, slo dying ember...

dialogues.speaker: END CREDITS ROLL...
dialogues.text: Teenager in the back of the movie theater shouts, "It's in the dog!"
